content:
list

listlist contains any sequence of items organized as a list. [3.8 Lists ]
Modulecore â€” Elements common to all TEI documents

    Note

    May contain an optional heading followed by a series of items, or a series of label and item pairs, the latter being optionally preceded by one or two specialized headings.

    Example
    <list rend="numbered"> <item>a butcher</item> <item>a baker</item> <item>a candlestick maker, with <list rend="bulleted"><item>rings on his fingers</item><item>bells on his toes</item></list> </item> </list>
    bibliography
    Schematron <sch:rule xmlns:sch="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron" context="tei:list[@type='gloss']"> <sch:assert test="tei:label">The content of a "gloss" list should include a sequence of one or more pairs of a label element followed by an item element</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
